text: The Dublin Evening Standard was a short-lived Irish newspaper that was published from 10 January to 23 May 1870. In May 1870 the newspaper ceased publication. Its title was incorporated with its main evening rival, the Dublin Evening Mail. Little is known about its ownership. Copies of its editions are available on microfilm in the National Library of Ireland. ==External links== * National Library of Ireland index information on the Dublin Evening Standard Category:1870 establishments in Ireland Category:1870 disestablishments in Ireland Category:Defunct newspapers published in Ireland Category:Evening newspapers published in Ireland Category:Publications established in 1870 Category:Publications disestablished in 1870
title: Dublin Evening Standard
